item.title: Star Wars is getting a turn-based strategy game called Zero Company
item.content:encoded:
https://www.theverge.com/news/648151/star-wars-zero-company-strategy-game-celebration

Jay Peters is a news editor covering technology, gaming, and more. He joined The Verge in 2019 after nearly two years at Techmeme.

The Star Wars strategy game announced in 2022 finally has a name: Zero Company, as EA revealed today. A website about the game describes it as a “single-player turn-based tactics game,” includes an image, and says that a “first look” will be shown at Star Wars Celebration Japan on April 19th.

Bit Reactor, a studio with team members that helped build other strategy games like XCOM and Civilization, is leading development alongside EA’s Respawn Entertainment and Disney’s Lucasfilm Games. It’s currently unclear when Zero Company might launch or what platforms it will be available on, but hopefully that information is shared during the first look at Star Wars Celebration.

Zero Company is one of three Star Wars games that Respawn said it was working on in January 2022. One of those games was Star Wars Jedi: Survivor, the sequel to Jedi: Fallen Order that came out in 2023. The third is an “all-new” FPS.
